type.name: section
type.title: Interpretation.
type.context: PUBLIC LANDS (PRIVATE ROADS) ACT under Interpretation. 2.  In this Act, road includes any track available for traffic by means of foot-passengers and beasts of burden only.
type.description: In this Act, road includes any track available for traffic by means of foot-passengers and beasts of burden only.

type.name: section
type.title: Grant of permission to construct and maintain private road on public lands.
type.context: PUBLIC LANDS (PRIVATE ROADS) ACT under Grant of permission to construct and maintain private road on public lands. 3. (1) The Minister may grant permission to anyone to maintain and construct on public lands any road necessary or useful for mining, woodcutting, or other purposes.  (2) If  the  road  passes  over  any  public  land  in  the  lawful occupation of another, the permission shall be granted with the consent of that other person, or subject to any terms as regards the making of compensation to him or otherwise prescribed by the Minister.

description.description: The Minister may grant permission to anyone to maintain and construct on public lands any road necessary or useful for mining, woodcutting, or other purposes.

If  the  road  passes  over  any  public  land  in  the  lawful occupation of another, the permission shall be granted with the consent of that other person, or subject to any terms as regards the making of compensation to him or otherwise prescribed by the Minister.

type.name: section
type.title: Conditions of grant of permission.
type.context: PUBLIC LANDS (PRIVATE ROADS) ACT under Conditions of grant of permission. 4.  The Minister may annex to the grant of any permission under this Act any terms and conditions he thinks proper, including the right to cut timber on public lands for the purposes of constructing and maintaining the road to which the permission relates, and may from time to time annex additional terms and conditions and modify or revoke any of the terms and conditions.
type.description: The Minister may annex to the grant of any permission under this Act any terms and conditions he thinks proper, including the right to cut timber on public lands for the purposes of constructing and maintaining the road to which the permission relates, and may from time to time annex additional terms and conditions and modify or revoke any of the terms and conditions.

type.name: section
type.title: Power to charge tolls for use of road.
type.context: PUBLIC LANDS (PRIVATE ROADS) ACT under Power to charge tolls for use of road. 5. (1) The Minister, by the grant or by any other instrument, may authorise the grantee of any permission under this Act to levy any tolls the Minister may fix in respect of the use of the road to which the permission relates by beasts of burden or vehicles.  (2) Subject to any general or particular direction of the Minister to the contrary, any road constructed and maintained under this Act may be used  without payment of tolls by foot-passengers, but the powers  given  by  this  section  shall  be  exercised  subject  to  any regulations made under this Act.

type.name: section
type.title: Licence of occupancy for land required for road.
type.context: PUBLIC LANDS (PRIVATE ROADS) ACT under Licence of occupancy for land required for road. 7.  In the event of any application being made by the grantee of permission under this Act for a licence of occupancy for public lands required by the grantee in connection with the use of the road to which the permission relates, the Minister may direct that the licence applied for shall not be subject to public competition.

type.name: section
type.title: Revocation of permission and resumption.
type.context: PUBLIC LANDS (PRIVATE ROADS) ACT under Revocation of permission and resumption. 8. (1) With the consent of the grantee of a permission under this Act,  or in the event of default in compliance with any terms and conditions   annexed  to  the  grant,  the  Minister  may  revoke  the permission.  (2) The Minister may direct possession to be resumed, for the benefit of the State, of the land occupied by the road to which the permission relates, and may if he thinks fit thereafter direct that the road shall be maintained and used, with the necessary modifications, in accordance with this Act.

description.description: With the consent of the grantee of a permission under this Act,  or in the event of default in compliance with any terms and conditions   annexed  to  the  grant,  the  Minister  may  revoke  the permission.

type.name: section
type.title: Notification of permission and its terms.
type.context: PUBLIC LANDS (PRIVATE ROADS) ACT under Notification of permission and its terms. 9. Notification shall be made in the Gazette of a permission granted under this Act and of any terms and conditions annexed thereto, and also of any table of tolls fixed under this Act.
type.description: Notification shall be made in the Gazette of a permission granted under this Act and of any terms and conditions annexed thereto, and also of any table of tolls fixed under this Act.

type.name: section
type.title: Application of Act to road made by Government.
type.context: PUBLIC LANDS (PRIVATE ROADS) ACT under Application of Act to road made by Government. 10. The Minister, out of any moneys provided by Parliament for that purpose, may cause any road to be constructed and maintained for any of the purposes mentioned in this Act, and may give any directions he thinks fit for the application to that road of all or any of the provisions of this Act; and the directions shall have the same force and effect as if they had been embodied in an Act.
